sense.name: a concise, well-known saying, proverb, maxim
sense.examples: John believes the old axiom that 'money talks'. It is an economic axiom that supply equals demand. The book argues that the old axioms of how to run a brick-and-mortar business do not apply to running one over the Internet.

sense.name: a non-provable postulate assumed to be self-evident
sense.examples: The axiom of choice in set theory states that for every collection of non-empty sets there is a function that chooses an element from each of them. The parallel postulate is an important axiom in Euclidean geometry. The Peano axioms are used to construct important number systems in mathematics.
